channel.title: New Dad WLA
channel.itunes:author: WonderAI
channel.description:
Join the adventure of modern fatherhood in the heart of West Los Angeles, where museum visits trump beach days and food trucks compete with fine dining. This fresh take on millennial parenting drops you right into the action, offering practical advice and relatable stories for dads navigating the unique landscape of raising kids in LA's cultural hub.
From discovering hidden gem restaurants perfect for toddlers to mastering the art of weekend cultural excursions, this podcast delivers insider tips and real-world solutions for fathers who prefer gallery openings to surf lessons. Each episode immerses you in authentic parenting scenarios, tackling everything from choosing the right family-friendly concerts to finding quiet moments in the city's most beloved museums.
Disclaimer: This description is experimental and was generated by AI. It may contain factual errors.
channel.itunes:summary: A millennial dads guide to raising culturally engaged kids in Los Angeles through food and museum adventures.

itunes:category.text: Kids & Family > Parenting, Arts > Food, Arts > Performing Arts

item.title: Potty Training at the Getty: A Dad's Cultural Survival Guide
item.itunes:title: Potty Training at the Getty: A Dad's Cultural Survival Guide
item.description:
Navigate LA's cultural landscape while mastering potty training with expert insights on timing, locations, and strategies. From the Getty Center's pristine early morning bathrooms to the Hammer Museum's strategically placed family restrooms, discover how to blend cultural enrichment with this crucial developmental milestone. The latest pediatric research supports a flexible approach to potty training between 18-42 months, making museum visits an ideal training ground. Learn why early opening hours offer the best experience, how to map bathroom-to-exhibit routes, and why venues like LACMA and the Skirball Cultural Center are perfectly equipped for families in transition. Strategic planning and positive reinforcement transform necessary bathroom breaks into opportunities for cultural discovery, proving that arts appreciation and potty training can successfully coexist.
Learn More: • "Respectful Parenting: Janet Lansbury Unruffled - Potty Learning: What Kids Need From Us" (https://wondery.com/shows/respectful-parenting-janet-lansbury-unruffled/episode/14755-potty-learning-what-kids-need-from-us/) • "Oh Crap! Potty Training: Everything Modern Parents Need to Know - Book" (https://www.amazon.com/Oh-Crap-Potty-Training-Everything/dp/1501122983) • "Potty Training in 3 Days: The Step-by-Step Plan - Book" (https://www.amazon.com/Potty-Training-Days-Step-Step/dp/1623157900) • "The Getty Center Family Guide" (https://www.getty.edu/visit/center/family/)
Note: This content was generated using artificial intelligence and may contain factual errors or inaccuracies. Please verify any important information from reliable sources.
